edu.ftdev

Class Drawing

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ftdev.Drawing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class Drawing
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Encapsulates a representation of a generic image file. A Drawing object can be created only by providing a valid image file as argument to its constructor. In return, the object can be used for accessing and modifying the image at pixel level.

      Drawing(int width, int height, Color bkgColor)
      Creates an instance of a Drawing as a rectangular image with the given width and height and filled with the given background color.

      • Drawing

        public Drawing(int width,
               int height,
               Color bkgColor)
        Creates an instance of a Drawing as a rectangular image with the given width and height and filled with the given background color.
        Parameters:
        width - - width of the drawing image in pixels.
        height - - height of the drawing image in pixels.
        bkgColor - - the background color of the drawing image.

    • Method Detail

                    throws IOException

        Throws:
        IOException

      • getImage

        public BufferedImage getImage()

      • reset

        public boolean reset()
        Resets the drawing image to its original state. If the image was created from a file, this method will reload the image from the file. If the image was created as a blank canvas, this method will clear the canvas to its original state.
        Returns:
        true if the image was reset successfully, false otherwise.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width of the drawing image.
        Returns:
        the width of the drawing image in pixels.

        public int getHeight()

        Returns:
        the height of the drawing image in pixels.

      • getGraphics

        Gets the Graphics2D object associated with the drawing image.
        Returns:

      • isValidPixel

        public boolean isValidPixel(int x,
                            int y)
        Indicates whether the pixel coordinates given as arguments fall within the bounds of the image. The top-left valid coordinate of the image is (0, 0), the bottom-right valid coordinate is (width-1, height-1).
        Parameters:
        x - - x coordinate value.
        y - - y coordinate value.
        Returns:
        true if both x and y are within their respective ranges, false otherwise.

      • isBrightPixel

        public boolean isBrightPixel(int x,
                             int y)
        Indicates whether the pixel at the given x and y coordinates is of a bright-toned color. This is defined as a color where each of the three color-components (R, G and B) have a value larger than 220.
        Parameters:
        x - - x coordinate value.
        y - - y coordinate value.
        Returns:
        true if the pixel has a bright-toned color, false otherwise.

      • isDarkPixel

        public boolean isDarkPixel(int x,
                           int y)
        Indicates whether the pixel at the given x and y coordinates is of a dark-toned color. This is defined as a color where each of the three color-components (R, G and B) have a value lesser than 30.
        Parameters:
        x - - x coordinate value.
        y - - y coordinate value.
        Returns:
        true if the pixel has a dark-toned color, false otherwise.

      • getPixel

        public Color getPixel(int x,
                      int y)
        Gets the color of the pixel at the given x and y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - - x coordinate value.
        y - - y coordinate value.
        Returns:
        the Color value at the given coordinates.

      • setPixel

        public void setPixel(int x,
                     int y,
                     Color c)
        Sets the pixel of the given x and y coordinates to the given color.
        Parameters:
        x - - x coordinate value.
        y - - y coordinate value.
        c - - the Color value to be set at the given coordinates.
